abstract: vijay century spurs india to 245-2 vs sri lanka in 3rd test .
article: delhi , india -- murali vijay raced to his 11th test century as india reached 245-2 at tea on day one of the third test against sri lanka on saturday . at the break , vijay was unbeaten on 101 and virat kohli was 94 not out . the pair put on 167 off 222 balls for the unbeaten third-wicket partnership with the runs coming at a blistering pace in delhi . after lunch , kohli reached his half-century off 52 balls . in doing so , he crossed 5,000 career runs in his 63rd test . india added 129 runs in 30 overs without losing a wicket in this second session of the day .

vijay and kohli brought up 100 for the third wicket off 121 balls , and then crossed 150 off 193 . india passed the 200 mark in the 46th over , 40 minutes before the tea break . vijay then reached his century off 163 balls , with nine fours , following up his century in the second nagpur test . india reached 116-2 at lunch after winning the toss and opting to bat . india leads the three-match series 1-0 after winning in nagpur by an innings and 239 runs . the first test in kolkata was drawn .
